intro: Buchtienia boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian buchtienia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with well-drained soil and full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
